soc.baseclient

Class ServerConnectInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • soc.baseclient.ServerConnectInfo

  • public class ServerConnectInfo
extends java.lang.Object
    Data class to hold the info a client must know to connect to a server.

    Includes an optional cookie field for robot clients to use. Does not include user's nickname or optional password.

    This class is a way to avoid having pairs of client constructors (for TCP and string sockets). It also gives a backwards-compatible way to give future versions' bot clients more server info or a new protocol's port number without changing their constructors.

    Since:
    2.2.00
    Author:
    Jeremy D Monin <jeremy@nand.net>
    See Also:
    SOCRobotClient

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.lang.String hostname
      TCP server hostname or IP address, or null when using memSocketName instead.
      java.lang.String memSocketName
      The server's stringport socket name if it's a same-JVM local server using MemConnection, or null when using TCP port instead.
      int port
      TCP port number for connecting to server on hostname, or 0 when using memSocketName instead.
      java.lang.String robotCookie
      Security cookie (weak shared secret) for robot connections to server.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ServerConnectInfo(java.lang.String host, int port, java.lang.String cookie)
      ServerConnectInfo to connect to a server using TCP.
      ServerConnectInfo(java.lang.String stringSocketName, java.lang.String cookie)
      ServerConnectInfo to connect to a same-JVM server using MemConnection.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • hostname

        public final java.lang.String hostname
        TCP server hostname or IP address, or null when using memSocketName instead. Localhost is stored as the string "localhost", not "127.0.0.1" or "::1".

      • port

        public final int port
        TCP port number for connecting to server on hostname, or 0 when using memSocketName instead.

      • memSocketName

        public final java.lang.String memSocketName
        The server's stringport socket name if it's a same-JVM local server using MemConnection, or null when using TCP port instead. Can be used by robots in local practice games.

      • robotCookie

        public final java.lang.String robotCookie
        Security cookie (weak shared secret) for robot connections to server. Required by server v1.1.19 and higher. Unused (null) for non-bot human clients.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ServerConnectInfo

        public ServerConnectInfo(java.lang.String host,
                         int port,
                         java.lang.String cookie)
        ServerConnectInfo to connect to a server using TCP.
        Parameters:
        host - Server hostname; see hostname for details
        port - Server port number. Default port is ClientNetwork.SOC_PORT_DEFAULT.
        cookie - Bot cookie, or null for human client; see robotCookie for details

      • ServerConnectInfo

        public ServerConnectInfo(java.lang.String stringSocketName,
                         java.lang.String cookie)
        ServerConnectInfo to connect to a same-JVM server using MemConnection.
        Parameters:
        stringSocketName - Server stringPort name; see memSocketName for details
        cookie - Bot cookie, or null for human client; see robotCookie for details
